short: You can describe a person unable to read or write as illiterate. Karaoke, which involves singing out the words to songs as they scroll across a big screen, requires the ability to read. If youŌĆÖre illiterate, you wonŌĆÖt be able to participate.
long: Illiterate, from the Latin illiteratus ŌĆ£unlearned, ignorant,ŌĆØ can describe someone unable to read or write, but it can also imply that a person lacks cultural awareness. However, Walt Whitman saw a unique beauty to illiteracy: ŌĆ£There is that indescribable freshness and unconsciousness about an illiterate person that humbles and mocks the power of the noblest expressive genius.ŌĆØ
